==Japanese==
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|おう|じょ|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=おうじょ}} compound {{m|zh|王女|tr=hjwang nrjo<sup>X</sup>|lit=king + female}}. The [[漢音#Japanese|''kan'on'']] reading, so likely a later borrowing.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|おうじょ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|おうじょ|hhira=わうぢよ}}

# [[princess]]

=====Antonyms=====
* {{ja-r|王子|おうじ}}: [[prince]]

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|おう|にょ|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=おうにょ}} compound {{m|zh|王女|tr=hjwang nrjo<sup>X</sup>|lit=king + female}}. The [[呉音#Japanese|''goon'']] reading, so likely the initial borrowing.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|おうにょ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|おうにょ|hhira=わうによ}}

# [[princess]]
